intro: Zephyranthes salinarum, commonly known as the salt marsh bellflower, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer or early autumn. The plant thrives in saline or brackish environments, often found in wetlands and coastal dunes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Zephyranthes salinarum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
